intro: Cienfuegosia humbertiana, commonly known as the Humbert's cienfuegosia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
